meanings.definition: A substance that prevents the growth of disease-causing microorganisms.
meanings.sent1: The hospital used antiseptic to keep the operating room free from harmful germs.
meanings.sent2: It is important to apply antiseptic to a wound to avoid infection.
meanings.sent3: The antiseptic danced around, keeping all the bad germs away.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an antiseptic, cleansing the negativity from the room.
meanings.sent5: The antiseptic shield protected the city from the invasion of harmful bacteria.

meanings.definition: A clean, sterile environment or condition.
meanings.sent1: The laboratory maintained an antiseptic environment to conduct experiments safely.
meanings.sent2: The surgical room was kept antiseptic to ensure the health of the patients.
meanings.sent3: The antiseptic room sparkled like a diamond, free from any dirt or germs.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an antiseptic, purifying the atmosphere of negativity.
meanings.sent5: The antiseptic aura of the place made everyone feel refreshed and clean.
